No Python coders allowed! #nflverse #rstats https://t.co/2bRvyOTMG0

Week 5 of the #nfl is behind us...and the @Steelers are officially bad ðŸ˜¢.  My model has dropped them to under 6 wins and into the driver's seat for next year's first pick.  Dark days indeed.  My model is very bullish on @BuffaloBills with 1/3 sims ending with a SB win #nflverse https://t.co/XIpn04PIjZ

And here are the model's best guesses for week 6, leading off with a @ChicagoBears win 61% of the time, with an expected 4-point win.  For the game of the week, the model slightly favors @Chiefs at home over the @BuffaloBills, with KC winning 52% of the simulations #nflverse https://t.co/WZKmJjuqNw

Snaps by formations for KC vs LV! KC still in mostly 11 personnel, with some 12 mixed in. We are just so much better with 3 WR's on the field (this is a Skyy tweet). On defense, we mixed it up a lot. Really good in 3-4-4. Not good in 3-2-6 (dime?)

#nflverse #rstats #gtExtras https://t.co/5bJBXLFEnS

Here's Vegas. 11 personnel was their most efficient outside of the TD in 2-1-1 (I think that's the 4th down TD to Adams). On defense, they played 4-2-5 75% of the time, and KC beat it pretty badly. 

#nflverse #rstats #gtExtras https://t.co/rbjjLxvrz6

Do you like these graphics? Would you like to be able to see it for other teams? You're in luck!! I turned this into a Shiny app! Just select the year, week, and team you want to see, and voila! You can even download the images!

https://t.co/L17Oj1RomI

#nflverse #rstats #shiny https://t.co/4D8odEQW7T

The "gold standard" that's quoted for Rookie WRs is >2.00 YPRR on >200 routes

Given we're only 5 weeks into the season, YPRR is prone to increased noise. Using data from the ffverse, #nflverse & @KeepTradeCut  here is Expected Rec Yards Per Pass Snap https://t.co/5rstsVav1o

Still waiting on MNF, but here are RB snaps by pass likelihood percentile from the other Week 5 games

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/voSfZpa52X

What the fuck am I seeing ?!?!? 
Rushing epa is higher then passing epa in the first 5 week?!?!??

#nflverse https://t.co/xCFE3yir6u

For @haleyeenglish17, Mahomes he faced more man coverage in the whole league and this year they are back to blitz him ...yes... Why?

#nflverse https://t.co/UOE9HNkmKQ

The best in the middle of the field.

#nflverse https://t.co/aXYtFuag5I

Was testing the NHL version and thought NFL fans can have a timeline viz, as a treat. Please Do Not expect any more kinds of NFL content out of me b/c I can only promise disappointment. Big shoutout to #nflverse for making the data I needed easy to get though! https://t.co/CvpmgiCwPv
The only 3 QBs who rank top 10 in EPA in 2021 and 2022 using #nflverse data are Patrick Mahomes, Justin Herbert and Jimmy G

EPA of every play this season for Daniel Jones and Trevor Lawrence:

Trevor Lawrence has been great in the third quarter with a league leading 0.569 EPA/play

Daniel Jones is 7th in the 3rd quarter with 0.305 EPA/play

#NFLVerse https://t.co/Oog5nvkF1S

Nice for the NFL to leave a 45 minute break for Sunday dinner, I suppose.

#nflverse https://t.co/30xQqFf4O9

Redoing this viz for #NFL QBs given we have a decent sample size of data to work with now.

We can see how QBs are tracking based on their cumulative EPA through the first six weeks.

Unfamiliar territory for one QB on that bottom row... ðŸ‘€

#nflverse https://t.co/SkIs2KPy9J

Snaps by Formations. KC offense first. Absolutely not our best outing, averaging just 0.05 EPA/play overall. The three plays with 3 TE's on the field were very ungood. Hardman and Moore are starting to split the snaps as WR3 in 11 personnel.

#nflverse https://t.co/sQbPQt0ed8

Here's our defense. Honestly not terrible. Averaged 0.14 epa/play vs one of the best offenses in the league. The 4-2-5 was very good, and was our most common formation. 3-3-5 and 4-3-4 (base) were absolutely lit on fire though... 

#nflverse https://t.co/KujDVLA2qf

Here's Buffalo's numbers. Their offense averaged 0.14 (compared to our 0.05) epa/play. They were very successful in 21 and 12 personnel. Their D was good in 3-3-5, and solid in 2-3-6. 

#nflverse https://t.co/9PzR2DMPSR

Also, if you like these charts, and want them on demand, check out this shiny app! Simply filter to the season, game, week, and team you want, and voila! You've got it! 

 https://t.co/L17Oj1RomI 

#nflverse

There was a lot of talk on the broadcast about Chiefs blitzes, especially after the Bills got two TD's on them. Here is every blitz KC ran, and the outcomes. 
 
4 drives ended (one in FG) 
2 TD's 
4 incompletions 
1 three yard completion on 1st & 10
1 first down 

#nflverse https://t.co/dTIRQ14x3H
